title: Armida 2014 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Caramel apple and honeyed, biscuity notes combine, layering richness upon richness in this single vineyard wine. A full-bodied, concentrated expression, its darker elements are complemented by an underlay of Key lime that provides a respite of freshness.

title: Cantina del Giusto 2012 Baradiero  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Leather, underbrush, grilled herb and charred earth aromas take center stage, accented by a balsamic note. The structured, medium-bodied palate offers juicy black cherry, coffee, licorice and rosemary flavors, framed by firm, fine-grained tannins. Drink or hold a few more years.

title: Château Ampélia 2016 Barrel Sample  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. While there are lots of spicy wood tones in this full, ripe wine, the fruit lends grounding balance. Black currant flavors and firm tannins give it good potential for the future.

title: Château du Retout 2014  Haut-Médoc
description: With an unusually high proportion (nearly 17%) of Petit Verdot in the blend, this is both darkly structured and dark in color. It is weight, intense youthful acidity and black-currant fruits. It's also rich, full of tannins and in need of several years. Drink from 2021.

title: Château Ducluzeau 2014  Listrac-Médoc
description: Owned by the Borie family, one of the grand families of Bordeaux, the vineyard forms part of Château Fourcas-Borie. The wine, with its dark tannins and dense texture, is powerful and concentrated. Layers of tannins show most strongly at this young stage, while the ripe juicy fruit will develop well. It is going to be a fine wine. Drink from 2021.

title: Château La Clare 2014  Médoc
description: From one of a group of chateaus owned by the Guyon family of Rolland de By, this is an intensely fruity wine. It has finely balanced tannins and acidity along with smoky flavors and layers of delicious black currant fruit. Drink from 2019.

title: Château la Vieille Cure 2014  Fronsac
description: With signs of its wood aging that are balanced with firm tannins and concentrated black fruits, this is a solid wine, packed with tannins. There is a touch of dark chocolate as well as the ripe fruit. It is a fine wine, ready to drink from 2020.

title: Bosque De Matasnos 2012  Ribera del Duero
description: Jammy blackberry aromas come with strong notes of creosote and asphalt but not much nuance. A saturated beefy mouthfeel and dark toasty black-fruit flavors are intense, while this tastes of chocolate and dark spices on a deep, pounding finish. Drink through 2024.

title: Brooks 2014 La Chenaie Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: Just three barrels were made of this rather unusual wine. It's a seemingly disparate mix of raspberries, gun metal, dried seaweed and carpaccio, yet somehow it all comes together. The length is impressive. This is one of those wines that will thrill some tasters and puzzle others.

title: Donum 2014 Year of the Horse Ten Oaks Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Full figured but soft in texture, this wine is otherwise light in approach and weight, with spicy acidity framing cardamom and black tea accents.
designation: Year of the Horse Ten Oaks Single Vineyard

title: Domaine Mersiol 2014 Elevé en Muid Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: There almost is a touch of red apple amidst all of the aromatic red and black cherries. The palate is juicy and concentrated—the finely-woven tannins crunch just a little and everything is brightened by freshness. This is a very harmonious, fruit-driven and juicy Pinot Noir that is full of ready joy. The finish is aromatic, long and moreish.

title: Emile Beyer 2015 Lieu-Dit Sundel Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: There is a hint of earth and roasted pumpkin on the nose. The palate has a similarly smoky and dusky aspect and surrounds crisp red-cherry fruit. The body is light with a slight but fine tannic grip. A pleasantly bitter finish counters the pumpkin richness. The finish is very fresh and dry but strangely moreish. This will benefit from a bit of bottle age. Drink now through 2022.

title: MacRostie 2014 Hellenthal Vineyard Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)
description: Earthy cherry and cardamom seize the palate at first, before a tang of pomegranate and cranberry sneaks in to provide freshness and minerality. Tannic in its youth, this medium-bodied red also offers a minty note of black tea.

title: Katnook Estate 2014 Founder's Block Cabernet Sauvignon (Coonawarra)
description: It's been some time since Katnook last submitted samples, so it's reassuring to see that quality there remains high. This medium-bodied Cabernet boasts crisp acids and fine tannins, highlighting notes of red currants, olives and bay leaves. Drink now–2025.

title: Jim Barry 2013 The McRae Wood Shiraz (Clare Valley)
description: This medium-bodied shiraz is remarkably fresh and vibrant, deftly blending maple syrup and smoke with red berries, then easing into a firm, dusty finish. Drink now–2025.

title: Jim Barry 2014 The Lodge Hill Shiraz (Clare Valley)
description: This juicy, medium-bodied Shiraz is filled with mouthwatering cherry-berry fruit. Some silky tannins provide structure, but this is much more about the here and now than any sort of cellaring. The fruit persists through the finish, joined by hints of herbs and bacon. Drink now–2020.

title: Josmeyer 2015 H Vieilles Vignes Pinot Auxerrois (Alsace)
description: A touch of vanilla clings to the yellow pear on nose and palate. The palate adds the merest hint of butterscotch spice. The body is balanced and fresh, clean, generous and intriguing.

title: Otazu 2006 Altar Red (Navarra)
description: Cool rooty aromas of cola and tree bark grace the nose on this ripe but still not fully mature Cabernet Sauvignon (with 5% Merlot). In the mouth, this is choppy due to sandpaper tannins. Flavors of sarsaparilla, pepper, and blackberry are dense and chewy, while the finish is bumpy and scraping due to aforementioned hard tannins. Drink or hold through 2022.

title: Il Conventino 2013  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
description: A blend of Sangiovese, Colorino and Canaiolo, this opens with grilled herb, toast, espresso and cured meat aromas. On the palate, clove and roasted sage notes add depth to tart red cherry and strawberry fruit. Fine-grained tannins and vibrant acidity provide the firm, elegant structure.

title: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2015 Vieilles Vignes Auxerrois (Alsace)
description: A fresh nose suggests both green and yellow pears. The palate shines with the freshness of both fruits—crisp, sunny, light and very fruity. The finish is clean and very refreshing.

title: Narmada 2014 Yash-Vir Red (Virginia)
description: Vibrant red-currant aromas meld with thyme and rosemary on the nose of this wine, while metallic and gamy qualities are also evident. The palate is intense in chocolate cherry, cassis, fennel and black pepper flavors. Leathery tannins usher in a long and woody finish.

title: Gloria Ferrer 2013 Gravel Knob Estate Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Bright strawberry and rhubarb flavors are pulled taut with tension and hearty tannin in this estate-grown wine from Gloria Ferrer. Cherry liqueur and dried herb notes add dimension and seasoning to the robust, oaky profile.

title: Gracciano della Seta 2015  Rosso di Montepulciano
description: Truffle, woodland berry and violet aromas take center stage in this luminous red. The fresh, juicy palate doles out sour cherry, crushed raspberry, thyme and clove flavors, framed by taut, polished tannins. A star anise note closes the finish. Drink through 2019.

title: Fontodi 2013 Case Via Syrah (Colli della Toscana Centrale)
description: Made entirely from organically farmed Syrah, this has inviting blackberry, black pepper and thyme aromas. The dense, robust palate delivers black currant, cedar and smoke notes, bolstered by chewy tannins. Drink through 2022.

title: Gregory Graham 2012 Crimson Hill Vineyard Grenache (Red Hills Lake County)
description: This full-flavored, richly textured wine offers impressions of plum, black cherry and dark chocolate shavings. It's big and broad on the palate, with a light layer of tannins and loads of easy-going enjoyment.

title: Pewsey Vale 2016 Individual Vineyard Selection Dry Riesling (Eden Valley)
description: This wine's aromas of lime sherbet and flower shop greens is textbook Eden Valley Riesling. This is a tight, cellar worthy wine, floral and citrusy on nose and palate, with medium body and a persistent finish. Drink now–2025.

title: Podere San Giacomo 2012  Brunello di Montalcino
description: You'll find wild red berry, coconut, leather, dark spice and balsamic notes on the nose of this wine. They infuse the palate, accenting its espresso-like flavor. It's full-bodied, with a backbone of close-grained tannins that give the finish grip. Drink 2019–2027.

title: Portal del Montsant 2014 Brunus Red (Montsant)
description: A potpourri of floral red-fruit, dried herb and wet cement aromas lead to a racy fresh palate that's mildly complex. Oaky red-berry flavors come with a note of chocolate, while this tastes lightly herbal on a lasting well-formed finish. Drink this Carignan-Garnacha through 2021.

title: Príncipe de Viana 2013 Edición Limitada Red (Navarra)
description: Aromas of cherry, plum, forest floor and tobacco feed into a clampy palate with fresh acidity. Lightly spiced currant and red-plum flavors are limited in scope but nice, while this tastes herbal and feels tight and racy on the finish.

title: Friedeman 2014 Dichotomy Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: A fairly priced varietal wine, this shows currant, cranberry, raisin and a flurry of allspice on the nose. It takes on rose petal and lavender aromas as it opens, making it all the more pleasant and memorable.
